isis.stitle: BE 200 BUS FRONT END AND BODY COMPONENTS - INSTALL - Exterior Body Components

svcprocinfo.para: This section describes the procedures required to install the exterior body components that may have already been removed. All necessary warnings and safety precautions remain in effect during these installation procedures.

svcsubproc.title: Bumper Assembly
svcsubproc.para: With an assistant, locate the bumper assembly with safety gate attached and carry the bumper to the bus chassis.

step1.para: With an assistant, place bumper at bumper mounting brackets, align bumper mounting holes with mounting holes in mounting bracket.
Insert bolts in the upper holes: one driver side, one passenger side. Hand tighten.
Locate the lower bumper mounting holes and insert lower bolts, and hand tighten.
Finish tightening the bumper bolts to the required torque values.
Torque bumper bolts to 50 to 55 LBF-FT (68 to 75 Nm).
Reconnect the appropriate harness connections as required.

svcsubproc.title: Hood
svcsubproc.para: Hood has been previously removed.
If required, assemble tilt assist support assemblies, splash panels and or insulator panels to the hood before installing hood.

step1.para: With an assistant, rest the hood assembly on a padded work stand.
Check the chassis cross bar for the alignment scribe line to locate hood hinge plate in its proper location.
Ensure that the hinge plate mounting bolts are in place on the chassis cross bar and that sufficient clearance is available to slide hinge plate in place.
With an assistant, place the hood assembly on the chassis cross bar and align with hinge plate mounting bolts. Check hinge plate location reference to scribed line.
With hinge plate in aligned position, tighten hinge plate mounting bolts ( Figure 119, Item 2). Tighten the hinge plate mounting bolts to required torque value.
With hood secured to chassis, locate a padded stand and place in front of chassis to support tilted hood.
Tilt hood forward and rest on padded stand.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. HINGE PIN SLEEVE BOLTS AND NUTS

step1.para: Locate torsion bars.

step2.para: Check torsion bars; smaller diameter torsion bar to be installed first.

step1.para: With smaller ( Figure 257, Item 9) diameter torsion bar shorter end, install in driver side torsion bar retainer bracket ( Figure 257, Item 7).
Install retainer clip on torsion bar end ( Figure 257, Item 8).

Lay torsion bar in torsion bar guide bracket ( Figure 118, Item 2) ( NOTE: This view is passenger side, driver side is reversed) on driver side and place opposite end of torsion bar in hood torsion bar retainer bracket ( Figure 257, Item 10). Hood may have to be slightly lifted to allow insertion of torsion bar in bracket.
Install retainer clip ( Figure 257, Item 11).

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. TORSION BAR UPPER MOUNTING BRACKET, PASSENGER SIDE
5. FRAME RAIL TORSION BAR END BRACKET (PASSENGER SIDE)
7. FRAME RAIL TORSION BAR END BRACKET (DRIVER SIDE)
10. TORSION BAR UPPER MOUNTING BRACKET, DRIVER SIDE

step1.para: Locate remaining torsion rod (12.5mm diameter).
Insert torsion rod end in passenger side frame torsion bar bracket ( Figure 257, Item 5).
Install retainer clip ( Figure 257, Item 4).
Place torsion bar over torsion bar guide and over previously installed torsion bar ( Figure 116, Item 2).
Insert torsion bar ( Figure 257, Item 9) end in driver side hood torsion bar bracket ( Figure 257, Item 10).
Install retainer clip ( Figure 257, Item 11).
Raise the hood to approximately a 45 degree angle and support it, to allow for reconnecting of the hood stop cables.
Place clevis ( Figure 114, Item 2) of hood stop cable ( Figure 114, Item 1) assembly over radiator top frame clevis mounting bracket.
Insert clevis retainer pin ( Figure 114, Item 4).
Follow same procedure for opposite side cable stop assembly.
With hood tilted, locate harness connections.
Reconnect front end wire harness connectors. Secure the wire harness with the clips and loop clamps provided, as necessary.
The front grille / shroud assembly may be reinstalled at this time.
Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.
The front bumper assembly may be reinstalled at this time.

svcsubproc.title: Grille / Shroud
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the grille and shroud assembly, inspect the mounting tabs on the inner upper surface of the shroud ( Figure 258). Insure that all tabs are functional and in place ( Figure 258).

figure.caption: Figure 258. Grille / Shroud Tab and Mounting Hole Inspection

step1.para: With the hood in the closed position, align the four (4) upper mounting holes ( Figure 121, Item 4) and tabs.
Insert tabs on shroud assembly into mounting holes ( Figure 121, Item 4) on hood assembly.
Align the lower grille/shroud mounting holes with tabs ( Figure 121, Item 5) on cross bar.
Insert the four mounting bolts ( Figure 121, Item 7) in the assembly and tighten.
Recheck for grille and shroud proper fit and alignment.
Tighten to 3 to 3.3 LBF-FT (4 to 4.5 Nm).

important.para: Do not overtighten the mounting screws.

svcsubproc.title: Splash Panels
svcsubproc.para: Prior to splash panel installation check panels for any breaks or cracks. Replace if necessary.
Beginning on the passenger side, with the front hood opened:

step1.para: Align the splash panel mounting holes with the hood mounting holes ( Figure 259, Item 1) and insert the mounting bolts and lock washers.
Hand tighten only.
Align the lower mounting holes with the inner fender section.
Insert the mounting bolts ( Figure 259, Item 1) and lock washers.
Tighten the splash panel mounting bolts.
Tighten to 125 to 140 in-lbs (14 to 16 Nm).
The lower splash panel on the passenger ( Figure 259, Item 4) side may be replaced if damage has occurred.
If the lower panel has been removed, locate the replacement panel and align with openings in the fender splash panel.
Insert the plastic insert fasteners through the lower splash panel ( Figure 259, Item 3 and 4) into the fender splash panel ( Figure 259, Item 2).

figure.caption: Figure 259. Splash Panel Remove/Install (Passenger Side Shown)

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. LOWER SPLASH PANEL PLASTIC TAB MOUNTS

figure.caption: Figure 260. Splash Panel Install (Driver Side Shown)

step1.para: Close hood and secure the hood latches.
With hood in the tilted position, locate the fender extension mounting holes on the cowl lower structure ( Figure 261, Item 1).
Align the fender extension mounting holes on the cowl mounting holes ( Figure 262, Item 3),

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. FENDER EXTENSION MOUNTING BOLTS AND HOLES

step1.para: Install mounting bolts and lock washers and tighten.
Torque the mounting bolts to 50 to 55 LBF-FT (68 to 75 Nm).

svcsubproc.title: Headlight Assemblies
svcsubproc.para: The grille and shroud assembly should have been previously removed.

step1.para: Insert the headlight assembly ( Figure 264, Item 4) into the headlight housing opening ( Figure 264, Item 1), aligning the mounting studs with the mounting holes in the headlight housing.
Locate and mount the mounting nuts on headlight assembly mounting studs and tighten.
Tighten the housing stud nuts to 11 to 13 LBF-FT (14.8 to 18.1 Nm).
Reconnect the headlight harness into the chassis harness located above the frame rail section at the opening below the vertical hood support bracket.
Tilt hood to closed position.
Insert the headlight assembly mounting bolt ( Figure 264, Item 5) into the headlight mounting tab (Item 6) and headlight assembly bolt hole (Item 8).
Tighten the headlight mounting assembly bolts to 34 to 38 LBF-FT (46 to 51 Nm).
Follow the same procedure for opposite side headlight assembly installation.

figure.caption: Figure 264. Headlight Assembly Remove and Install (Driver Side Shown)

step1.para: Secure the hood latches.
Install grille / shroud assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Head Lamp
svcsubproc.para: When installing new halogen head lamp bulbs, it is recommended to follow the bulb manufacturer's instructions for proper handling of the halogen bulb.

step1.para: Insert halogen bulb in socket assembly.
Install seal as needed.
Place bulb and connector in headlight housing receptacle.
Twist retainer to lock in place.
Install socket cover.
If no other bulbs are to be replaced, close hood and secure hood latches.

svcsubproc.title: Fog Lights
svcsubproc.para: Insert the fog light assembly into the center opening of the front bumper and locate the mounting hole.

step1.para: Align and insert fog light assembly and mounting bracket on lower cross member bar. Install flat washer and lock nut, finger tighten. Adjust the fog light direction and tighten mounting lock nut.
Plug fog light harness into headlight assembly harness.

svcsubproc.title: Hood Latches
svcsubproc.para: With hood in the tilted position:

step1.para: Align the mounting holes of the lower latch assembly with the mounting holes in the cowl assembly.
Insert the mounting bolts through the lower bracket assembly and cowl section. Install the flat washer and lock nut on the inside of the cowl section and tighten.
Tighten lower latch bracket mounting bolts to 34 to 38 LBF-FT (46 to 51 Nm).
Locate the latching arm and clip assembly and place in the upper bracket assembly.
Place the upper bracket latch mechanism on the hood section and align the mounting holes on the bracket with those located on the hood assembly.
Insert the mounting bolts through the latching assembly and hood.
Install the flat washer and lock nuts on the mounting bolts and tighten.
Tighten upper mounting bolts to 34 to 38 LBF-FT (46 to 51 Nm).
Lower hood and latch both sides of the hood.
Follow same procedure for installation on opposite side.

svcsubproc.title: Hood Seal
svcsubproc.para: To install the hood seal, release the hood latches both sides and tilt hood forward if not already tilted.

figure.caption: Figure 266. Hood Seal Remove and Install

step1.para: Align the hood seal across the entire top surface of the cowl lip.
Begin peeling back the adhesive protective strip.
Locate the christmas tree attachment hole and insert the tree through the hood seal and adhesive.
Insert the fastener in the cowl hole, apply pressure to the seal causing the adhesive to attach to the cowl lip.

Continue peeling the adhesive strip cover material and press hood / cowl seal in place on the forward edge of the cowl. Continue pressing down on seal causing the adhesive to attach to the portion on the cowl edge.
Insert the christmas tree fastener through the opposite side hood seal into the mounting hole in the cowl.
Check that seal is pushed down on edge as far as is allowable. Lower hood and secure hood latch.
Locate reservoir bottle on frame rail mounting brackets.
Align mounting holes on reservoir and mounting brackets and insert mounting bolts.
Tighten reservoir mounting bolts ( Figure 151) to required torque values. ( See Torque Chart)
Place seal gasket on nipple end of windshield washer fluid pump ( Figure 150, Item 1).
Place pump assembly with nipple inward into reservoir receptacle.
Push pump assembly into opening area until unit snaps into place.
Connect windshield wiper washer supply hose to pump connection ( Figure 148, Item 2 and 3).
Connect harness plug to pump assembly connection.
Refill windshield wiper fluid to proper level.
Install fill cap.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. MIRROR BASE MOUNTING STUD WITH LOCK NUTS AND WASHERS

step1.para: With an assistant holding the mirror base assembly, locate and align the base mounting holes and the fender mounting holes. Insert the mounting bolts through the fender assembly, place the fender reinforcing plate over the bolts, install lock washers and nuts. Tighten until snug.
Install the mirror bracket attachment clamps ( Figure 154, Item 4) to the mirror main support bracket ( Figure 154, Item 3).
Adjust clamp locations as necessary.
Locate the mirror / fender support bracket ( Figure 154, Item 9, and align with mounting hole in fender ( Figure 153, Item 1).
Insert the mounting bolts through the bracket end and fender section. Install the flat washer and lock nut on the underside of the fender section and hand tighten ( Figure 153, Item 1).
Place the opposite end of support bracket in attachment clamp ( Figure 153, Item 4) on mirror main support bracket.
Insert bolt, lock washer and nut and tighten.
Locate and align the mirror support bracket end mounting hole with the mounting hole in the side surface of the hood ( Figure 154, Item 1) assembly.
Insert the mounting bolt through the bracket end and hood section. Install the flat washer and lock nut.
Place the opposite end of support bracket in attachment clamp on mirror main support bracket.
Follow the same procedure for the opposite side mirror assembly.
Locate the electromagnet lock device and bracket, align with mounting holes in driver side front bumper. Insert bolts, lock washers and lock nuts. Tighten to required torque value.
Reconnect magnet harness.

Locate drive motor and place on inside of passenger side of bumper assembly. Place drive arm section through slot in bumper and align mounting bolt hole in bumper with motor mounting holes. Insert mount bolts (4) and tighten to required torque.
Slide safety gate arm assembly on end of drive arm.
Align safety gate arm mounting holes with mounting holes on drive arm. Insert bolts and tighten.
Reconnect drive motor harness connection with front end harness.
Check operation of gate to insure proper alignment of gate and magnet.

svcsubproc.title: Windshield Wiper Install
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installation of the windshield wiper assembly, check blades and washer fluid hoses for replacement.

step1.para: Locate the windshield wiper drive stud and mark previously located to help set alignment of wiper arms.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. WINDSHIELD WIPER DRIVE STUD MOUNTING JAM NUT

step1.para: Place windshield wiper arm on drive stud aligning the previously marked parts.
Install the mounting nut and hand tighten.
Follow the same procedure for the opposite side if both wiper arms have been removed.
From the driver position, turn the ignition key, and turn on the wiper switch on. Allow at least one full cycle of wiper operation.
Turn the wiper switch to the off position and allow the wipers to go to the park position.
Turn the ignition key off. Go outside the bus and check the location of the wipers in the parked position.
Check dimensions as specified in the Figure below.
If the location is correct, tighten the wiper arm retaining nut to the proper torque value (See Torque chart).
If the wiper arm is not in correct position, remove retaining nut, reposition wiper arm, and check dimension.
Install wiper arm retaining nut and torque to correct value.
Replace plastic cap on wiper arm assembly covering retainer nut.
Reconnect windshield washer fluid supply hoses at cowl and windshield wiper arm.

Operate the windshield wipers and washer to verify correct operation. If wipers contact each other or the window frames during operation, or if they look close and might contact each other or the windshield frame, adjust the wiper arm orientation as needed.

svcsubproc.title: Windshield Install
svcsubproc.para: Prior to windshield installation, the windshield glass should be inspected for cracks and or chips. The windshield fence structure and locator tabs should be inspected for any type of bends or damage that might create problems in seal mounting and/or possible leaks. The windshield seal should also be checked for breaks, cracks or any other deformity that might cause windshield leaks or improper fit.

warning.para: Always wear safety glasses and gloves to prevent accidents from occurring. Extreme care should always be taken when handling glass and repair tools.

para.emph: An assistant is required during the installation of the three piece windshield.

step1.para: Prior to installing the 3 piece windshield:

step2.para: Check the windshield mounting frame (fence) and mounting tabs for any bends or distortion in the assembly. Straighten if necessary.

Check the windshield "S" seal for any cracks, breaks or deterioration. If found replace "S" seal. Check the windshield glass for cracks or chips in the glass or the edges. If the glass edge is chipped it should be ground smooth prior to installation.

When handling glass avoid contacting the glass with anything that might chip or crack the edges of the glass. Pressure on the glass will tend to concentrate at the chipped areas, causing cracks. If the glass is cracked, do not install. Replace with a new section.

step1.para: For large applications such as the windshield center section, install the mounting seal on the windshield frame around the opening.

step2.para: Align the seal on the insert tabs and lower windshield mounting frame.
Spray a foam type window cleaner or soapy water solution on the windshield seal. This will lubricate the seal and help in the installation of the windshield glass.
With an assistant, locate the windshield glass panel section from the padded work stand and place in approximate position on the cowl assembly.

With the technician and an assistant on the opposite side of the bus windshield area, place the glass in the lower section of the windshield seal. Using a flat stock windshield tool work the glass into the lower seal section.
Align one side of the glass into the vertical seal section at the tee seal connector. Recheck the alignment on the tab assembly.
Using the flat stock tool, ensure the glass is in the position in the vertical section. Use the same tool on the inside of the windshield to properly seat the glass in the vertical section.

With the assistant on the outside of the windshield glass, steady the assembly, insert a 1/8" rope section in the glass seal around the upper section of the main glass panel. Spray the glass again with a soapy solution to help insert the glass into the upper seal.
The assistant from the outside should apply a steady pressure against the upper portion of the center glass toward the windshield frame.

The technician using the glass tool should encapsulate the top corner of the windshield glass on the fence (or frame), then with a constant, steady pulling motion on the rope work his way across the top of the interior of the windshield glass, checking the glass is seating in the seal as he pulls the rope. If the step is done properly the windshield should be mounted in the seal on the windshield frame around the top and bottom and both ends of the center panel.

With the windshield glass properly seated in the top and bottom frame, use the flat stock tool and/or other appropriate glass tool as may be available to work the seal around the opposite end of the vertical windshield seal.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. ALIGNING SEAL AND GLASS ON UPPER MOUNTING FENCE

step2.para: Check both the interior and exterior of the windshield panel for any irregularities in the seal that could cause a leaking condition.

step1.para: Prior to installing side panel or wing glass, check the glass for cracks or chips.

step2.para: Align seal with windshield frame at wing panel area.
Place the wing or side panel glass at the top corner of the seal and align the inboard edge in the vertical seal adjacent to the center windshield panel.
Spray the seal and glass with soapy solution to aid in installation of glass.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. WINDSHIELD FLAT TOOL WORKING SEAL PERIMETER

step2.para: Using flat stock glass tool or other appropriate glass tool, work seal around the outside edge of the wing panel glass. Pressure should be applied against glass to fit glass into seal.
Continue around the exterior perimeter of panel or wing glass until entire panel is seated on window frame section.
Follow the same procedure on the inside of the wing panel ensuring the glass in inserted in the seal assembly.
Follow the same procedure for the opposite side wing panel (if necessary).

para.emph: The recommended windshield lace insertion tool : Lock Strip Straight Tool, Part number 201-1127 from Sommer Maca.

step1.para: A sufficient length of windshield lace should be on hand for installation. A single piece length is required to fit the entire perimeter of the windshield opening. Two additional sections for the vertical panels between the windshield and wing panels are required. Prior to installation find the center of the lace perimeter section and place at the approximate center of the windshield seal at the top of the windshield.

step2.para: To install the lace rubber into the seal, use the lacing tool by threading the lace rubber into the tool. Depending on the method used and the direction in which the lace is installed will determine whether the tool is pushed or pulled while inserting the windshield lace.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. VERTICAL WINDSHIELD AND WING PANEL SEAL

step2.para: After installation of the surround lace, install the two remaining vertical pieces between the panel glass sections and the center windshield panel.
A foam type glass cleaner or mild soapy solution and some water can be used to lubricate the rubber seal. This will ease installation of the lace rubber.
Inspect the installation and clean off the surface of the glass, both inside and outside the bus.
A pliable windshield seal may be used to seal the rubber and glass.

svcsubproc.title: Driver Side Rear View Mirror
svcsubproc.para: Check mirrors for cracks or any type of damage prior to installation. If the mirrors have a heater element option, check the wires and plug for breaks in the harness wire or cracks.

step1.para: Beginning on the driver side of the bus body, locate and align the mounting holes in the mirror and bus body.
Insert the four mounting bolts ( Fig. 28, Item 3) and hand tighten.

If the mirror has the optional mirror heater, locate the harness wire ( Fig. 28, Item 2) and insert through the grommet in the body section. Connect the mirror harness plugs in the appropriate harness connections in the upper corner of the electrical compartment located under the drivers window on the exterior of the bus.
Tighten the mirror mounting bolts to the required torque value.
Enter the bus, open the driver sliding window and adjust the mirror to the proper settings.

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Side Rear View Mirror
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the passenger side rear view mirror ( Fig. 29), check the mirrors for cracked mirror glass or any harness damage.

step1.para: Place a step ladder at the passenger side of the bus body by the passenger entry doors.
Locate the mounting holes for the mirror support brackets and hand tighten along the header above the top of the windshield assembly.
Align the mirror support bracket mounting holes with the header mounting holes, insert the bracket mounting bolts.
Locate the mirror base mounting holes on the "A" pillar forward of the side entry door. Align the mirror base with the mounting holes and insert the four mounting bolts. Hand tighten.
Attach the passenger side mirror support clip bracket to the mirror arm. Insert the attachment bolt, washer and lock nuts as required.
Adjust the mirror position and tighten all mounting bolts to the required torque.
If the mirror is equipped with optional heater element locate the mirror harness and insert into body harness hole. Install grommet on mirror harness, and insert grommet in opening.
Locate the mirror heater element harness and plug in the mirror connectors. Replace the "A" pillar cover.
Install the passenger side "A" pillar cover on the inside of the bus body. insert mounting screws in pillar cover, tighten. Install "A" pillar plastic cap covers over mounting screws.
Check mirror for adjustment, adjust as necessary.

svcsubproc.title: Front Warning Lights
svcsubproc.para: Replacement of the upper front warning lights on the face of the front end cap.

step1.para: Tilt the hood forward. Using a step ladder to allow access to the end cap light locations, insert the warning light wire harness through the grommet.
Connect the warning light plug into the harness plug and insert in body opening.
Insert the grommet into bus end cap. Feed excess wire through grommet into the end cap.
Place warning light on end cap and align mounting holes.
Insert mounting screws and tighten.
Locate the warning light lens on the light assembly, insert the lens mounting screws and tighten.
Follow the same procedure for replacement of all other warning light assemblies on end caps.

svcsubproc.title: Destination Sign

warning.para: Always wear eye protection and other safety equipment when handling glass to minimize the risk of injury.

svcsubproc.para: The back lit destination board if previously removed because of damage to the glass area should be replaced only with IC Corporation authorized replacement parts to ensure the proper fit and operation.

To ease installation, the rubber gasket can be heated with a non-flame source (heat gun). At high temperatures, the rubber gasket is more pliable. Do not heat above 125 degrees Fahrenheit for longer than one and a half hours.

Avoid contacting the glass with anything that may chip or crack the edges. Pressure on the glass will tend to concentrate at the chipped areas, causing cracks. If the glass is chipped, the edge should be ground smooth prior to installation.

step1.para: Tilt the hood to forward position, cover engine components to protect from any dirt or debris.
The glass destination sign is installed utilizing an "H" type glass seal. Locate the seal to be installed and check the seal for breaks or cracks.

For large installations such as the windshield glass, install the rubber gasket or seal onto the flange of the glass opening. For smaller applications, such as the entrance door, the rubber gasket should be located on the glass itself.
Insert the hook end of the windshield installation tool into the seal and work the glass into the opening.
With the glass seated in the seal check the fit around the perimeter of the glass for distortion or cracks.
To install the lace rubber into the rubber gasket or seal, use the lacing tool by threading the lace rubber into the tool and installing the rubber.
Pull the lace rubber around the gasket, feeding the lace rubber into the tool using a hitching motion. This will help prevent the lace rubber from stretching.
A foam type class cleaner or a mild soap and some water can be used to lubricate the rubber gasket. This will ease installation of the glass lace rubber.
Inspect the installation and clean off the surface of the glass.
Seal the rubber gasket and glass with a pliable windshield type sealant.

svcsubproc.title: D.O.T. Lights and Reflectors
svcsubproc.para: The D.O.T. lights mounted on the exterior of the body as required by F.M.V.S.S. must be replaced if cracked or broken.

step1.para: To replace a damaged reflector, locate the mounting hole of the removed reflector ( Fig. 33, Item 1).
Insert the mounting screw through the center hole of the reflector and mounting hole in the bus body. Tighten the mounting screw till snug.
Broken D.O.T. marker lights or lens must be replaced if broken or damaged.
Locate the lens mounting hole, insert the lens mounting screw, and align with the mounting hole on the marker light assembly.
Tighten the marker light lens mounting screw.
If the light assembly was broken and removed, locate the marker light mounting hole on the bus body.
Locate the harness and plug in the new marker light connector. Insert the marker light wire through the body grommet and insert the grommet in the body panel.
Align the marker light mounting hole with body mounting holes. Insert the mounting screws and tighten. Replace the lens cover (see step 4).

svcsubproc.title: Vandal Lock
svcsubproc.para: The Vandal lock assembly is located at the front panel above the passenger side transition panel forward of the passenger entry door (if equipped).

step1.para: Prior to installing the vandal lock assembly through the bus body panel, install the jam nut and washer on the assembly stem. Allow extra length for mounting the exterior mounting nut and washers.
Install the vandal lock assembly from inside the bus body by sliding the assembly stem through the opening in the body panel.
Install the exterior lock washer and threaded collar.
From inside the bus slide the interior lock washer against the body panel. Tighten the jam nut against the washer and body panel.
Connect the vandal lock wiring leads to the harness connection ( Figure 174).
Check the assembly from outside the bus to ensure a snug tight fit.
Replace the dash panel.
Locate the mounting holes at the lower joint of the passenger entry dash panel and the lower edge of the right wing switch panel.
Locate the 2 dash panel mounting holes at the leading edge of the dash panel by the bottom edge of the windshield assembly.
Align the 2 dash panel mounting holes and insert the two mounting screws. Tighten the mounting screws to the torque value required.
Locate the mounting screws along the lower edge of the dash panel, insert the mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.title: Assist Steps
svcsubproc.para: The assist steps ( Fig. 175, Item 2) are mounted each side of the bus body directly behind the front fender extension and below the transition panel.

step1.para: Locate the assist step body mounting holes and align the assist step assembly bracket holes on the body holes.
Insert the two mounting bolts through the bus body panel.
Install the lock nuts and washers behind the panel and tighten to the required torque value.

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Entry Door
svcsubproc.para: Installation of the passenger entry doors may require the help of an assistant when aligning the pivot pins and blocks.

step1.para: With an assistant, place the forward door in the upright position at the door opening. Insert the upper pivot pin in the overhead header opening.
Locate the lower pivot block and slide on lower pivot pin, align pivot block mounting holes with mounting holes in lower step door opening cross bar.
Insert the mounting bolts in the pivot block and support bar.
Check door in position and pivot points, and ensure door swings freely.
Locate the door mounting bracket attached to the door opener drive arm. Align the bracket mounting holes with the mounting holes in the upper portion of door frame.
Insert two mounting bolts and tighten to required torque.
Follow the same procedure on opposite door if applicable.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Fill Door
svcsubproc.para: Depending on the location of the fuel tank assembly the fuel door may vary in location. All fuel doors have a positive closure spring, and may be equipped with a latching device or keyed lock. Locate the opening where the fuel fill door assembly is to be installed.

step1.para: Locate the fuel fill door assembly over the opening in the bus body side panel.
Align the mounting holes in the fuel fill door assembly with those in the bus body side panel.
Insert the six mounting screws in the fuel fill door assembly and tighten ( Fig. 178, Item 1).

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Windows
svcsubproc.para: Passenger windows and related hardware are installed from the inside of the bus body. Reference Body Interior installation section.

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Exit Windows
svcsubproc.para: Emergency exit windows and related hardware are installed from the inside of the bus body. Reference Body Interior installation section.

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Exit Doors and Latches
svcsubproc.para: The rear emergency exit door is a flush mounted door assembly with interior recessed hinges.

step1.para: Prior to installing the door assembly, check the door seal for cracks and or breaks in the material. Replace if necessary.
With an assistant locate the emergency exit door in the bus body door opening.
Locate the hinge assemblies on the inside of the door assembly. Rotate the door hinge assemblies out and align with the hinge mounting plates on the inside of the door frame assembly.

Locate the mounting bolts in the hinge assembly ( Fig. 181, Items 1 and 2) and hand tighten. Open the door and close to check for door fit in the opening. Adjust the door assembly as may be required. Tighten the hinge bolts, install the remaining hinge bolts, and torque to the required value.
Check the alignment with the door latch assembly and the buzzer plunger switch.
If the door is aligned and functional, install the plastic hinge covers on the interior hinge assemblies.
Locate the mounting holes in the plastic covers, and align with mounting holes in bus body.
Insert mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.title: Roof Mounted Escape Hatch

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death always use a secured scaffold assembly and safety restraints when servicing the bus roof panels or roof component accessories. An assistant should be present during any roof or roof accessory repair procedures.

svcsubproc.para: Check the roof surface around the opening of the emergency roof hatch assembly. Make sure no sharp edges or foreign materials are present when installing sealer or the hatch assembly.

step1.para: Clean the roof area around the hatch opening prior to any installation procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 278. Emergency Roof Escape Hatch Opening

step1.para: Locate the roof hatch assembly on the opening and align the hatch mounting holes with the mounting holes in the roof section.
Apply any sealer required to the roof or hatch assembly prior to fastening the hatch assembly in place.
Install the emergency escape hatch in the opening.
Align the mounting holes in the hatch perimeter frame and the mounting holes in the roof panel.
Using an industrial type rivet gun, insert the rivet in the mounting holes and secure the hatch assembly to the roof structure.
Install plastic fastener covers over fasteners on the hatch assembly.
Apply sealant around the outside perimeter of the hatch assembly at the roof line.
Connect hatch open alarm switch harness to bus harness connectors.
Install the interior trim ring in the ceiling, insert mounting screws and tighten.
Place plastic insert caps over the mounting screws.

svcsubproc.title: Wheelchair Access Door
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the wheelchair access door, check the door seals for cracks or breaks in the door seal. Replace if necessary.

step1.para: With an assistant place the access door in the door opening. Check the alignment of the hinge mounting holes with the mounting holes in the bus body. Adjust the door as may be required.
Install the door hinge mounting bolts and hand tighten. Recheck the door alignment and seal for proper fit.

figure.caption: Figure 279. Wheelchair Lift Access Door Hinges

step1.para: If the door fits securely, tighten and torque door hinge mounting bolts to required torque values.
Check the door latch alignment, ensure proper latching and locking.
Check the alarm buzzer assembly plunger for proper alignment and operation.
Adjust as necessary.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Bumper Assembly
svcsubproc.para: An assistant is required for rear bumper installation.

step1.para: With an assistant locate the bumper to the rear of the bus body and align the rear mounting holes ( Fig. 185, Item 2) on the bumper with those on the rear frame bumper mounting bracket.
Insert the upper mounting bolts through the bumper into the bumper mounting bracket. Install the bumper mounting bolt nuts and washers on the mounting bolts and hand tighten.
Locate and install the lower rear bumper mounting bolts through the bumper and mounting bracket.
Install the mounting nuts and washers on the bumper mounting bolts and hand tighten.
Locate and install ( Fig. 185, Item 1) the remaining side bumper mounting bolts (2 each side) with nuts and washers. Hand tighten side bumper mounting bolts.
Check the alignment of the bumper assembly with the body. Locate and align the bumper transition panels at each end of the bumper assembly and side body panels.
Tighten all bumper mounting bolts and lock nuts to the required torque value.
Install the bumper transition panel mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Body Exterior Lights and Warning Lights
svcsubproc.para: The rear body warning lights and standard stop / tail, directional and back-up lights all follow the same removal and install procedure.
A step ladder is required to access the warning light mounted on the end cap assembly.

step1.para: Locate the end cap light mounting locations. Insert the warning harness wire and connector through the grommet.
Connect the warning light plug into the harness plug and insert in body opening.
Insert the grommet into bus end cap. Feed excess wire through grommet into the end cap.
Place warning light on end cap and align mounting holes.
Insert mounting screws and tighten.
Locate the warning light lens on the light assembly ( Fig. 188, Items 1 and 2), insert the lens mounting screws and tighten.
Follow the same procedure for replacement of the stop / tail lights, back-up lights and directional lights.

svcsubproc.title: Street Side Body Stop Signs
svcsubproc.para: Prior to mounting optional street side body stop signs, check the wiring harness connectors and the wiring access hole for proper grommet fit.

step1.para: Locate the wire harness connection and plug into the body harness. Feed the excess wire through the grommet.

Locate the stop sign mounting holes in the body side sheet. Align the stop sign assembly mounting holes with the body holes ( Fig. 189, items 1 and 2) and insert the mounting screws as required ( Fig. 190, Item 3).
Tighten the mounting screws.

svcsubproc.title: Rubber Fenderettes
svcsubproc.para: With an assistant, locate the rubber fenderette at the rear wheel well opening.

step1.para: Locate the mounting holes in the fenderette, and align with the mounting holes in the wheel well opening trim ring ( Fig. 191, Item 1).

Begin inserting the mounting bolts approximately every fourth bolt with washer and lock nut and hand tighten. There are 21 per side. With the pilot mounting bolts in place, install the remaining mounting bolts, washers and lock nuts.
Tighten all remaining nuts and recheck the fenderette alignment around the wheel well opening.
Torque all the lock nuts to the required torque value.

svcsubproc.title: Under Body Compartments (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: The under body compartments can be installed without the door assemblies in place.

step1.para: With an assistant, locate the body compartment in the area of the compartment opening. Using a hydraulic lift or other mechanical means, raise the compartment assembly in place.
Locate the door frame assembly on the body side panel and align the mounting holes.
Insert the mounting screws through the door frame face plate assembly holes and tighten.
Locate the luggage box hanger bracket on the rear of the compartment assembly.
Install the "J" clip around the upper flange of the chassis frame rail. Locate the bracket mounting hole and the rear bracket hanger mounting hole.

Insert the mounting bolt through the frame bracket and compartment hanger bracket. Install the washer and lock nuts as required. Tighten the underbody "J" clip mounting bolts at the compartment mounting bracket.

caution.para: To avoid damage to vehicle electronic components, disconnect both battery positive (+) and (-) negative cables prior to any welding operations. Attach the welding ground cable as close as possible to the part being welded. If necessary to weld close to an electronic component, it is recommended that the component be temporarily removed.

step1.para: Check the surfaces on the flange edges of the compartment and the surface area of the floor structure where the compartment flange surface and the floor structure surface meet. Ensure that both surfaces are clean and free of dirt, undercoating or debris, prior to spot welding the compartment flanges in place.
When the compartment assembly has been welded in place, torque the "J" clip mounting bolts to the required torque value.
Clean all surfaces and undercoat or paint as necessary.
Seal all overlap joint seams with yellow sealer. Allow to dry before painting.

svcsubproc.title: Electrical Compartment Door
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the electrical compartment door assembly, check the door seal for breaks and or cracks that might cause a leak problem into the chassis electrical compartment.

step1.para: Locate the door assembly hinge mounting holes and align them with the hinge mounting holes. The hinge assemblies are slotted for door adjustment.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ELECTRICAL COMPARTMENT DOOR / HINGE MOUNTING NUTS

step1.para: Insert the hinge mounting bolts and nuts and tighten.
Close the electrical compartment door and check the seal and fit. If necessary loosen and adjust the mounting bolts and nuts in the hinge slots.

svcsubproc.title: Battery Compartment

important.para: Excessive voltage or current applied to electronic components may damage or destroy them, resulting in expensive repairs.

caution.para: To avoid damage to vehicle electronic components, disconnect both battery positive (+) and (-) negative cables prior to any welding operations. Attach the welding ground cable as close as possible to the part being welded. If necessary to weld close to an electronic component, it is recommended that the component be temporarily removed.

svcsubproc.para: The battery compartment face plate is mounted to the outside skin of the bus body panel and is mounted utilizing with Phillip head mounting screws along the front face perimeter.

step1.para: Prior to installing the battery compartment assembly, check the floor structure flanges for undercoating, paint, dirt and or debris. Clean surfaces where attachment points are to be welded in place.
Locate the battery compartment in the opening and support in place by jacks or other mechanical means.
Locate and align the mounting holes on the front face of the compartment assembly with the holes in the body side panel.
With the floor structure flanges clean and free of dirt and debris, spot weld the battery compartment mounting flanges to the floor structure flange assembly.
Install the battery tray and related hardware.

svcsubproc.title: Radio Antenna
svcsubproc.para: The entertainment radio antenna connection mounting is directly behind the driver side window (if equipped) ( Figure 48).

step1.para: Feed the antenna wire through the body opening with grommet on antenna wire. Insert grommet in body opening as required.
Locate the antenna mounting holes on the body, align the antenna mounting base and insert the mounting screws.
Tighten the mounting screws, and plug antenna end into radio.

svcsubproc.title: Driver Side Sliding Window
svcsubproc.para: The driver sliding window assembly is an aluminum extruded framed horizontal sliding dual panel window. The window individually slides forward and aft in the window frame. The window is secured with a positive latching device.
To install the driver sliding window:

step1.para: Prior to installation check the window frame and opening for old sealant, dirt and or debris. Clean as necessary.
Place the driver storm window assembly into the window frame opening.
Locate the (4) frame mounting screws located in the bottom extrusion, (2) screws on the forward vertical frame and (3) screws across the top lip flange.
Insert the (4) mounting screws on the bottom of the window assembly extrusion. Tighten the mounting screws.
Locate the mounting holes in the forward vertical extrusion, insert the two mounting screws and tighten.
Install the mounting screws along the top extrusion of the window frame.
Double check the window for fit and apply seal around window frame area as may be needed.

svcsubproc.title: Driver Side Storm Window (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: The driver side storm window procedure follows the same procedure as listed above.

svcsubproc.title: Transition Panels
svcsubproc.para: The transition panels are comprised of two assemblies, driver side and passenger side panels. Prior to installation check the surface areas for any caulking or seal that may remain from the removed panels.

step1.para: Align the transition panel mounting holes with mounting holes in the cowl and body panels.
Insert the top mounting screws in the cowl panel and hand tighten ( Fig. 194, Item 1).

Check the alignment of the rear edge of the transition panel with the body mounting holes. Beginning at the top of the transition panel align and insert mount screws in the transition panel rear cover reinforcing strip ( Fig. 194, Item 2 and 4).
Locate the bottom recessed mounting screw in the lower center recessed mounting hole and tighten ( Figure 194, Item 5).
Check the perimeter of the transition panel for any gaps and re-adjust if necessary.
Apply sealant along the rear edge of the rear transition panel reinforcing strip as needed.

svcsubproc.title: End Caps
svcsubproc.para: The end caps on the front and rear of the bus body are replaceable. Care should be taken in the process or removal and installation of the assemblies.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death always use a secured scaffold assembly and safety restraint when servicing the bus roof panels or roof component accessories. An assistant should be present during any roof or roof accessory repair procedures.

note.para: When replacing end caps, some interior panels are required to be removed to drill pilot holes through the roof bows, for the end cap attachment process.

svcsubproc.para: When replacing the front cap assembly, the driver bulkhead compartment and any equipment mounted on it will have to be removed to access the roof bow assembly.
This includes:

item.para: First aid kits and Body fluid clean-up kits.
Driver interior rear view mirror and sun visor (if applicable).
The forward ceiling panel or rear depending on end cap being replaced.
Any other items that may be options that would be mounted on the driver overhead bulkhead.

step1.para: With the applicable interior items removed, mount the forward end cap on the roof assembly and header assembly.
Insert bolts in the lower forward edge and corners of the end cap assembly. Check the fit and alignment with the roof panels.
From the inside front section of the bus, drill through the roof bow and roof panel holes, through the end cap assembly.
With the roof bow holes drilled, prior to installing pilot rivets, install sealer adhesive along the existing roof panel and under the rear edge of the end cap.
Install pilot rivets across roof bow to ensure alignment.

Beginning at the front corner over the windshield install rivets through the new end cap mounting holes ( Fig. 53, Item 5) into header assembly and side section over driver window frame and entry door frame.
Insert the remainder of roof bow rivets as required and check joint seals at end cap and front roof panel.
If end cap seats properly, re-install interior bulkheads, and equipment that may have been removed.
Re-install the front windshield assembly (see windshield installation).
Install the end cap marker light and connect marker light harness plugs.
Seal all seams prior to paint.
If bus is equipped with glass destination board, install the glass panel and seal as described in section.

svcsubproc.para: Follow the same basic procedure for rear end cap. Rear emergency door and windows need not be removed.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death always use a secured scaffold assembly and safety restraint when servicing the bus roof panels or roof component accessories. An assistant should be present during any roof or roof accessory repair procedures.

step1.para: Locate the static roof vent opening in the bus roof. Check the edges of the opening for old seal gasket material or sharp edges.
Locate the static roof vent and gasket assembly on the roof aligning the mounting holes in the roof vent and the roof ( Fig. 200, Item 3).
Using an industrial type rivet gun, insert the rivets through the static roof vent flange into the roof panel assembly.
Seal as necessary and allow seal to dry before painting.

svcsubproc.title: Optional Roof Mounted Warning Lights
svcsubproc.para: Roof mounted clear strobe light assembly ( Figure 51).

step1.para: Prior to installing the roof mounted strobe light, ensure the surface is clear and clean of any dirt or debris.
Locate the strobe light harness connection plug, and the body harness connection. Connect the plug assemblies, install the body grommet on the harness wire and insert in the body opening.
Locate the mounting gasket and place on body section. Align the mounting holes on the light base and insert fasteners.
Tighten fasteners and check gasket for proper seal.

svcsubproc.title: Body Attachments or Tie Downs
svcsubproc.para: The body attachment tie downs are mechanical fasteners that secure the body floor panels to the chassis frame rail. This application consists of a combination of body tie down clips.

caution.para: Failure to properly torque tie down bolts can result in body damage.

step1.para: Check for anti-squeak pad. If it is missing, install. Locate the 1/2"-13 x 13 in "J"-clip and bolt around the chassis frame rail and insert in floor frame structure ( Fig. 195, Items 1, 3 and 4).

step2.para: Install the washers and lock nuts.
Torque the "J"-clip bolt to 30-40 Lbf-ft.

step1.para: Locate the shear bolt mounting angle at the upper section of the bumper mounting bracket assembly and chassis frame rail ( Fig. 196, Item 3).

step2.para: Align the mounting holes in the shear angle assembly with the holes in the floor structure flange.
Insert the 1/2"- 13 x 13" mounting bolts, washers and lock nuts.
Torque the mounting bolts to 30-40 Lbf-ft.

step1.para: Locate the formed tie down end in the notch in the floor flange structure. Locate the opposite end under the frame rail flange ( Fig. 197, Items 4 and 5).

step2.para: Locate the 1/2"-13 x 2 1/2" bolt through the formed tie down and floor structure flange.
Install the washer and lock nut and tighten to 30-40 Lbf-ft.

step1.para: Locate the mounting hole in the driver platform frame assembly. Insert the 1/2"-13 x 4" mounting bolt through the compression spring and through the driver platform frame mounting hole ( Fig. 198, Item 4 and 5).

step2.para: Install the flat washer and mounting nut. Torque to 50-60 Lbf-ft.
